div.p: Most illustrious man and to me to be revered as a father, the conversation was so abruptly ended that the matter has been deferred to the next assembly, in which a better form will be prescribed; everyone has already departed. I have scarcely been able to manage with the Württembergers up to this point; when my health permits, which I also hope will be before Christmas, I will come to you. If only Melanchthon had received your letters; oh, how many benefits would have followed for the Christian republic. But more on these matters in person, God willing.
Meanwhile, may you all fare much better and pray to God for me, as I am afflicted with a severe cough and forced to rest due to a cold.
To the most illustrious and in every virtue most excellent lord Heinrich Bullinger, to be revered as a father. Zürich.
